story: Mahmoud Ibrahim shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Exploring the FileSystem APIs - HTML5 Rocks
caption: html5rocks.com
description: The FileSystem APIs give applications the ability to read/write files and directories in a secure, sandboxed file system on a user's local machine.

data.message: I haven't read the article yet, but wouldn't that be a security risk?

I don't think so, coz it's just giving u an isolated storage on the client machine for only ur app or as it's mentioned in the article "sandboxed section of the user's local file system.".
 It's like the IsolatedStorage in silverlight if u r familiar with silverligh
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bdts8hk0(v=vs.95).aspx

And after all everything happens only if the client grant ur app the appropriate permissions.
